intro: Roepera sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf roepera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has narrow, sessile leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Roepera sessilifolia is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
